name: AzureAd
help: Manage Azure Active Directory Graph entities needed for Role Based Access Control.

properties.name: DisplayName
properties.help: The display name of the application.

properties.name: AppRoles
properties.help: Declare the roles you want to associate with your application. Should be in manifest json format. See examples below for details.

properties.name: AvailableToOtherTenants
properties.help: The application can be used from any Azure AD tenants.

properties.name: CredentialDescription
properties.help: The description of the password.

properties.name: EndDate
properties.help: Date or datetime after which credentials expire(e.g. '2017-12-31T11:59:59+00:00' or '2017-12-31'). Default value is one year after current time.

properties.name: Homepage
properties.help: The url where users can sign in and use your app.

properties.name: IdentifierUris
properties.help: Space-separated unique URIs that Azure AD can use for this app.

properties.name: KeyType
properties.help: The type of the key credentials associated with the application.

properties.name: KeyUsage
properties.help: The usage of the key credentials associated with the application.

properties.name: KeyValue
properties.help: The value for the key credentials associated with the application.

properties.name: NativeApp
properties.help: An application which can be installed on a user's device or computer.

properties.name: Oauth2AllowImplicitFlow
properties.help: Whether to allow implicit grant flow for OAuth2.

properties.name: Password
properties.help: App password, aka 'client secret'.

properties.name: ReplyUrls
properties.help: Space-separated URIs to which Azure AD will redirect in response to an OAuth 2.0 request. The value does not need to be a physical endpoint, but must be a valid URI.

properties.name: RequiredResourceAccesses
properties.help: Resource scopes and roles the application requires access to. Should be in manifest json format. See examples below for details.

properties.name: StartDate
properties.help: Date or datetime at which credentials become valid(e.g. '2017-01-01T01:00:00+00:00' or '2017-01-01'). Default value is current time.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: Id
properties.help: Identifier uri, application id, or object id.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: All
properties.help: List all entities, expect long delay if under a big organization.

properties.name: AppId
properties.help: Application id.

properties.name: DisplayName
properties.help: The display name of the application.

properties.name: Filter
properties.help: OData filter.

properties.name: IdentifierUri
properties.help: Graph application identifier, must be in uri format.

properties.name: ShowMine
properties.help: List entities owned by the current user.

properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: Add
properties.help: Add an object to a list of objects by specifying a path and key value pairs.  Example: --add property.listProperty <key=value, string or JSON string>.

properties.name: ForceString
properties.help: When using 'set' or 'add', preserve string literals instead of attempting to convert to JSON.

properties.name: Remove
properties.help: Remove a property or an element from a list.  Example: --remove property.list <indexToRemove> OR --remove propertyToRemove.

properties.name: Set
properties.help: Update an object by specifying a property path and value to set.  Example: --set property1.property2=<value>.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: DisplayName
properties.help: Object's display name or its prefix.

properties.name: MailNickname
properties.help: Mail nickname.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: Always create a new group instead of updating the one with same display and mail nickname.

properties.help: If true, only membership in security-enabled groups should be checked. Otherwise, membership in all groups should be checked.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: A URI to use as the logic name. It doesn't need to exist. If not present, CLI will generate one.

properties.name: Role
properties.help: Role of the service principal.

properties.name: Scopes
properties.help: Space-separated list of scopes the service principal's role assignment applies to. Defaults to the root of the current subscription.

properties.name: SdkAuth
properties.help: Output result in compatible with Azure SDK auth file.

properties.name: SkipAssignment
properties.help: Skip creating the default assignment, which allows the service principal to access resources under the current subscription.

properties.name: Cert
properties.help: Certificate to use for credentials.

properties.name: CreateCert
properties.help: Create a self-signed certificate to use for the credential.

properties.name: Keyvault
properties.help: Name or ID of a KeyVault to use for creating or retrieving certificates.

properties.name: UserPrincipalName
properties.help: Required. The user principal name (someuser@contoso.com). It must contain one of the verified domains for the tenant.

properties.name: ForceChangePasswordNextLogin
properties.help: Require the user to change their password the next time they log in.

properties.name: ImmutableId
properties.help: This must be specified if you are using a federated domain for the user's userPrincipalName (UPN) property when creating a new user account. It is used to associate an on-premises Active Directory user account with their Azure AD user object.

properties.name: MailNickname
properties.help: Mail alias. Defaults to user principal name.

properties.name: PrincipalId
properties.help: If --consent-type is "Principal", this argument specifies the object of the user that granted consent and applies only for that user.

commonTaskProperties.name: Debug
commonTaskProperties.help: Increase logging verbosity to show all debug logs.

commonTaskProperties.help: Show this help message and exit.
